fields.summary: MetricsSystemImpl creates MetricsSourceAdapter with wrong time unit parameter.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The test TestLazyWriter is consistently failing in trunk. For example:

https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/12407/testReport/

comments.body:
Start from commit {{9538af0}} brought by jira [HADOOP-12348], this test is failing consistently in trunk. Please double check this.

Test failure message is like:
{code}
-------------------------------------------------------
 T E S T S
-------------------------------------------------------
Running org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyWriter
Tests run: 7, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 146.403 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyWriter
testSynchronousEviction(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyWriter)  Time elapsed: 12.973 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<1> but was:<0>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:542)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.LazyPersistTestCase.verifyRamDiskJMXMetric(LazyPersistTestCase.java:483)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyWriter.testSynchronousEviction(TestLazyWriter.java:75)
{code}

Attached patch..
Please review...

[~surendrasingh] thanks for taking this issue...Following testcases are failing from HADOOP-12348, It's better to address all as part of this issue and change the defect summary..you can check https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/12407/testReport/ ( same is mentioned in that issue description)

{noformat}
All Failed Tests

Test Name
Duration
Age
 org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyPersistLockedMemory.testReleaseOnEviction	10 sec	2
 org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyPersistReplicaPlacement.testSynchronousEviction	13 sec	2
 org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyPersistReplicaPlacement.testFallbackToDiskFull	0.77 sec	2
 org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.TestLazyWriter.testSynchronousEviction
{noformat}

Thanks [~brahmareddy] for comment..
HDFS-9074, HDFS-9073 already created for other test cases..

I think, the correct fix would be to fix at the metric system level. 

Say, allow metric system to support cache TTL in millis, only for tests.
May be we can have a config in "hadoop-metrics2" with name, "periodMillis" and this will have priority over "period" which is in seconds.
So, any future tests which tests based on JMX metrics need not wait till the metric is updated.
Default value of 'periodMillis' can be decided based on requirement, may be 100msec or even 10msec.

Any thoughts?

Thanks [~vinayrpet] for suggestion...
Attached patch , Please review ...

This message was automatically generated.

Failures are not completely gone. Only {{TestJMXGet}} is passed.

I think may be even 10 msec is more in Jenkins. As all tests passes locally with this, but not in jenkins.
We can make it to 1 msec, but changing that, will affect all tests, which are not monitoring metrics.
So I recommend, we can keep configuring periodMillis for tests, along with that we can wait for the metric to be updated to expected value.
Now tests need not wait for max 10 sec for the update. We can keep 100msec for periodMillis.

So IMO, its safe to combine v1 and v2 patches.

Thanks [~vinayrpet] for review and suggestion. 
Attached updated patch..

002:
	1. Combine v1 and v2 patches
	2. moved {{LazyPersistTestCase#waitForMetric()}} in {{DFSTestUtil}} so other test can can use it.

Please review..
